alert.note: Alert for Peoria; Tazewell (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 3:32AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Tazewell and south central Peoria Counties through 400 AM CDT... At 332 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Marquette Heights, or over Pekin, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... East Peoria and Morton around 345 AM CDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 155 between mile markers 26 and 31. Interstate 474 between mile markers 8 and 14. Interstate 74 between mile markers 96 and 108. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
